page.title: 10HISTORICAL SITES
page.content: {THE STONE CIRCLE}at Torbreck, near Ness Castle dates back to the Bronze Age. It is 5.2m in diameter and has 9 standing stones, the largest being 2.13m high.The size of the circle is in keeping with the inner space of a Clava cairn where the important rites were enacted. {KNOCKNAGAEL BOAR STONE}is carved in a Pictish style (5th_8th centuries) with scrolls to emphasise the animal's muscles. These animal symbols are mainly in areas where Columba brought Christianity to the Picts of Scotland. In 1928, at{CULDUTHEL MAINS FARM} the owner's grandfather found a{BRONZE {AGE CIST}which is now in an Edinburgh museum.The farmer's wife believes that more graves with jewellery could be found between the Boar Stone and Smithton Woods.
